alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 10:24PM CDT until June 12 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN TARRANT COUNTY... At 1024 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mansfield, moving northeast at 50 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR MANSFIELD. HAZARD...Baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Fort Worth, Arlington, Grand Prairie, Mansfield, Burleson, Crowley, Forest Hill, Kennedale, Everman, Rendon, Pantego, Dalworthington Gardens, Lake Arlington and Joe Pool Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. Move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
